<@U04HBT25DM1>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Cypress test failed`
*Topic:* `Cypress Tests`
*Description:* `Hi team,

This cypress test is failed on master branch:
app/e2e-tests/pr/wl-pet-food-tests/wl-pet-food-onboarding/petFoodOnboardingFlow.spec.ts

With the following error:
expected KN-5-0800-2000-3WEEKLY to equal KN-3-0800-2000-3WEEKLY

Can you please check and fix, thanks.`
*Expected behaviour:* `Cypress test success`
*Actual behaviour:* `Cypress test failed`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

<@U0829PFG3LM>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Remove Fresh MPs from 'Our Products' page for customers that are not logged in`
*Topic:* `Homepage`
*Description:* `Fresh MPs (Chicken, Turkey Beef, and Variety) are all viewable on the 'Our products' page for all visitors. Because the Fresh MPs are only available to customers in specific regions, these should not be on the full product page when a customer is not logged in.`
*Expected behaviour:* `Fresh MPs not viewable on the 'Our Products' page for logged out customers`
*Actual behaviour:* `Fresh MPs are viewable on the 'Our Products' page for all customers `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
<@U0829PFG3LM> - thanks for sharing the opportunity, I would like to understand more the rationale?

I dont see an issue why all users shouldnt see them. On a similar note, we are exposing mixed plan, even though we dont offer it for users with less than 250 kcal.

elements.text:
- thanks for sharing the opportunity, I would like to understand more the rationale?

I dont see an issue why all users shouldnt see them. On a similar note, we are exposing mixed plan, even though we dont offer it for users with less than 250 kcal.

_thread_replies.text: I think it's best practice to not show products customers cannot buy. Understand that is the case in <250 kcals but I think we should avoid this happening where we can. How much of a lift is it to change? <@U0177S413PC> also looping you in here

elements.text: I think it's best practice to not show products customers cannot buy. Understand that is the case in <250 kcals but I think we should avoid this happening where we can. How much of a lift is it to change?

_thread_replies.text: Since 75% of customers don’t have access to these fresh bundles, I do think it’s worth removing it for them to see vs a smaller % for <250 kcals

elements.text: have access to these fresh bundles, I do think
worth removing it for them to see vs a smaller % for <250 kcals

_thread_replies.text: hi! was looking at the bundles for a different purpose, and noticed they still show when logged out / on the "our products" page even logged in with an ineligible address. maybe if easier, these can just be removed from "our products" all together, since eligible customers would see them elsewhere?

elements.text: hi! was looking at the bundles for a different purpose, and noticed they still show when logged out / on the "our products" page even logged in with an ineligible address. maybe if easier, these can just be removed from "our products" all together, since eligible customers would see them elsewhere?

attachments.fallback:
<@U0829PFG3LM>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `New advent calendar add-on needs to be the first product in the 'Select Add-ons' carousel on the TPT dashboard`
*Topic:* `Menu & Recipes`
*Description:* `We are launching the a Holiday treat calendar as an add-on W41 and want the calendar to be featured as the first add-on customers see in the 'Select Add-ons' category on customers dashboard. To do this, the Advent Treat Calendar needs to be listed first in the treat category and then the treat category needs to be the first category that's slotted for viewing in the 'Select Add-ons' section. This format needs to stay from W41 to W52. Let me know if any questions `
*Expected behaviour:* `Advent calendar is the first add-on in the 'Select Add-Ons' section.`
*Actual behaviour:* `Advent calendar is not the first add-on in the 'Select Add-Ons' section.`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue
attachments.text:
<@U0829PFG3LM>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `New advent calendar add-on needs to be the first product in the 'Select Add-ons' carousel on the TPT dashboard`
*Topic:* `Menu & Recipes`
*Description:* `We are launching the a Holiday treat calendar as an add-on W41 and want the calendar to be featured as the first add-on customers see in the 'Select Add-ons' category on customers dashboard. To do this, the Advent Treat Calendar needs to be listed first in the treat category and then the treat category needs to be the first category that's slotted for viewing in the 'Select Add-ons' section. This format needs to stay from W41 to W52. Let me know if any questions `
*Expected behaviour:* `Advent calendar is the first add-on in the 'Select Add-Ons' section.`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food

_thread_replies.text: fyi I think you can control this yourself by adjusting the index for the addon category. I believe featured is always the same order as the categories (e.g. the same order as when you're scrolling the full addons page), but might be wrong !

elements.text: fyi I think you can control this yourself by adjusting the index for the addon category. I believe featured is always the same order as the categories (e.g. the same order as when you're scrolling the full addons page), but might be wrong !

_thread_replies.text: The order for the featured products doesn't seem to match the order for the full add-on page

elements.text: The order for the featured products doesn't seem to match the order for the full add-on page

_thread_replies.text: it doesn't ? - I see supplements then treats in both screenshots

elements.text: it doesn't ? - I see supplements then treats in both screenshots

_thread_replies.text: right i'm saying the order within the category. Probiotic chews is featured but isn't slotted first within its category, same with lamb sticks.

elements.text: right i'm saying the order within the category. Probiotic chews is featured but isn't slotted first within its category, same with lamb sticks.

_thread_replies.text: oh yes picking what is added to featured isn't about the order within the category (I believe featured is a check box in the item description, but could be wrong), but the order of items WITHIN featured is the same as the order of addon categories (e.g. supplements, then treats, then air-dried) i believe

elements.text: oh yes picking what is added to featured isn't about the order within the category (I believe featured is a check box in the item description, but could be wrong), but the order of items WITHIN featured is the same as the order of addon categories (e.g. supplements, then treats, then air-dried) i believe

_thread_replies.text: featured you can add in the section on recipe tab fyi

elements.text: featured you can add in the section on recipe tab fyi

_thread_replies.text: add-ons section index i believe is what shows the order of treats, supplements, etc (highest to lowest) but im sure someone can confirm - it's been a bit!

elements.text: add-ons section index i believe is what shows the order of treats, supplements, etc (highest to lowest) but im sure someone can confirm - it's been a bit!
